page.title: 02Cropwell Bishop Quarries
page.content: {Gypsum }has been mined and quarried in Cropwell Bishop since about 1900.All land from Pasture Lane to Kinoulton Road and towards Nottingham Road was mined originally but No:1 Quarry was opened in 1948 by{Pipewell Ploughing {Company,}who worked it until 1953 when the{Gotham Company}put in its own draglines.Water from mines and quarries was pumped through dykes to enter the River Smite at Colston Bassett. The quarry was closed in 1958 due to the closenes of the mineworkings, with a danger of{ flooding. The quarry had an average depth of 50feet.The main use of the{ gypsum was for plaster of paris, surgical use, etc. The land is now used for cereal crops, in rotation with root crops, having been restored to agricultural use in 1959. {BY: Matthew Simpson & Mark Healing
